paper_abstract: Let G = (V, E) be a graph with vertex set V and edge set E. A subset F subset of E is an edge total dominating set if every edge e is an element of E is adjacent to at least one edge in F. The edge total domination problem is to find a minimum edge total dominating set of G. In the present paper, we prove that the edge total domination problem is NP-complete for planar graphs with maximum degree three, and for undirected path graphs, a subclass of chordal graphs and a superclass of trees. We also design a linear-time algorithm for solving this problem in a tree. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the algorithmic complexity of edge total domination
